chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
l: pos n
h: pos n
a: pos n
s: pos n
Hsa: s <> a
Hsh: s <> h
Hsl: s <> l
Hah: a <> h
Hal: a <> l
Hhl: h <> l
lt: list (list bool * list bool)
p: nat
i: nat
lFD: nat
pre: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
spec: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
f: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Vector.t (list bool) n
Hf: forall v : Vector.t (list bool) n, v <> f v
C2: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
C1: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
v: Vector.t (list bool) n

Goal:
pre v -> {C1 v} + {C2 v}

Premises:

copy_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> v#>z = nil -> w = v[(l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, copy_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (16 + i, w)

transfer_ones_spec_1 : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (b : bool) (k : nat) (l : list bool) v (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>x = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l -> st = (p, v[l/x][(list_repeat b k ++ v#>y)/y]) -> (i, transfer_ones x y i p q b) // (i, v) -> > st
decoder = fun (c h l : pos n) (q : nat) => let decoder_error := PUSH c Zero :: POP c q q :: nil in fix decoder (s i : nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) {struct lt} : list (bsm_instr n) := match lt with | nil => decoder_error | (th, tl) :: lt0 => POP c (3 + length (tile h l th tl) + i) q :: tile h l th tl ++ PUSH c Zero :: POP c s s :: decoder s (3 + length (tile h l th tl) + i) lt0 end : pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> nat -> nat -> list (list bool * list bool) -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments decoder _ _ _ (_ _ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope

cs_spec_rec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (l m : list bool) v, v#>x = l -> v#>y = m -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z) /\ (l = m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (p, w)) /\ (l <> m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (q, w))
move_rev_stack_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, move_rev_stack x y i) // (i, v) -> > (7 + i, w)
compare_stack_neq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) v, v#>x <> v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
full_dec_start_spec_1 : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> forall (p q i : nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c <> nil -> (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (5 + i, v)
tiles_solvable = fun lt : list (list bool * list bool) => exists ln : list nat, ln <> nil /\ Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln /\ (let (hh, ll) := tile_concat ln lt in hh = ll) : list (list bool * list bool) -> Prop Arguments tiles_solvable _%list_scope
compare_stack_eq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) v, v#>x = v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (p, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)

```coq
intros.
destruct (classic (C1 v)) as [HC1 | HC1].
- left. apply HC1.
- right. apply HC1.
Qed.```
